snippet: Pakistan’s Supreme Court issued a contempt-of-court notice against Prime Minister Raja Pervez Ashraf on Wednesday, signaling a rerun of judicial proceedings that saw his predecessor ousted from office in June.
abstract: Pakistan’s Supreme Court issues a contempt-of-court notice against Prime Minister Raja Pervez Ashraf, signaling a rerun of judicial proceedings that saw his predecessor ousted from office in June; he is ordered to appear before the court and explain why his government refused to revive a corruption investigation into President Asif Ali Zardari’s finances in Switzerland.

byline.original: By DECLAN WALSH and SALMAN MASOOD

lead_paragraph: Pakistan’s Supreme Court issued a contempt-of-court notice against Prime Minister Raja Pervez Ashraf on Wednesday, signaling a rerun of judicial proceedings that saw his predecessor ousted from office in June.

headline.seo: Raja Pervez Ashraf Faces Contempt Charges in Pakistan
headline.main: New Pakistani Premier Faces Contempt Notice on Corruption Inquiry
headline.print_headline: New Premier In Pakistan Faces Order From Court
